descriptor.name: Soil Health Card (Central)
descriptor.long_desc: Soil health card provides information to farmers on the nutrient status of their soil along with recommendations on appropriate dosages of nutrients to be applied for improving soil health and fertility. Soil Health Cards help farmers to improve productivity by maintaining soil health. This card will also promote the judicious use of fertilizers, thus reducing the cost of production for the farmer.  To increase soil fertility and productivity, it is important to know the nutrient status and make necessary amendments by appropriate dosage of fertilizers and micronutrients.

descriptor.name: Do you or any of your family members own any land?
Marketing and Input_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc: NCDC assists in strengthening the cooperative marketing structure with the objective of ensuring remunerative prices to the producers of agricultural commodities and narrowing down the price spread between the producer and the consumer. NCDC provides direct financing and support in the form of:  1. Margin money assistance to Marketing Federations/Societies 2. Working capital finance for marketing   In case of business promotion viz. margin, money/ working capital/strengthening of share capital quantum of assistance can be up to 100% of the requirement.  Terms and conditions:  1.  The debt-equity ratio considering all long term loans should normally be in the range from 65:35 to 70:30 for       projects involving manufacturing/processing activities; 2.  The cooperative should not have any major default in repayment of loans to NCDC/Banks/Financial       Institutions. 3.  The value of assets to be mortgaged to NCDC as security against the loans should have an adequate security       margin, normally not less than 1.25 to 1.5 times.

list.value: (1)Term loan (Margin money and working capital) up to 65–100% of the project cost

Equity Grant Scheme_Small Farmers Agri Business Consortium ( SFAC)_Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc: Equity Grant Scheme extends support to the equity base of Farmer Producer Companies (FPCs) by providing matching equity grants subject to maximum of Rs. 10 lakh per FPC in two tranche within a period of 3 Year and to address nascent and emerging FPCs which have paid up capital not exceeding Rs. 30 lakh with a view to the undernoted primary objectives:  a) Enhancing viability and sustainability of FPCs .  b) Enhancing credit worthiness of FPCs.  c) Enhancing the shareholding of members to increase their ownership and participation in their FPC.

Financing for Storage Facilities_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc: National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) functions under the Ministry of Cooperation. It is responsible for planning, promoting, and financing cooperative societies in various sectors, including agriculture, food processing, dairy, fisheries, and rural industries. NCDC provides financial support through loans and subsidies to cooperative societies for various projects, including agriculture, rural development, and allied sectors. Under the scheme eligible cooperative societies are assisted for the construction and repair/renovation of godowns depending upon the potential. The Corporation also encourages primary cooperatives to prepare business development plans to expand their non-credit business and for utilization of godowns to their maximum capacity. Rate of subsidy on Capital Cost is 33.33%  Under the scheme, financial assistance is being provided for the following activities:- - For Storage infrastructure projects. - For infrastructure projects other than Storage (Primary processing viz. sorting, grading, chilling, freezing etc.) - Stand-alone cold storage units up to 1000 MT are allowed. - Assistance for renovation will be allowed and restricted to Storage infrastructure projects of Cooperatives routed through NCDC only for project cost as appraised by Bank / NCDC or actual cost or Rs. 750/- per MT of Storage capacity, whichever is lower.

list.value: Term loan up to 65% of the project cost
Brief bio-data of Board of Directors

Financing for Cold Chain_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc:
Cold Chain is an uninterrupted temperature-controlled logistic chain, ensuring market link from farm gate to the consumer. It is kind of supply chain that is specialized in the storage, transport, and preservation of cargo that needs to be maintained at a specific temperature or within an acceptable temperature range, humidity, etc.

Major Components of funding Cold Chain:

1. Modern Pack Houses with Pre-coolers and a small cold room
2. Transportation (Refrigerated / normal ventilated trucks depending on the product)
3. Cold Storage (Bulk) at farm gates for long term inventory
4. Cold Storage (Hub) near Consumption Centres as a distribution platform
5. Ripening Units

Loan ranging from 45 to 60% and subsidy ranging from 15 to 50% depending on the sub-scheme available with NCDC.

list.value: Loan ranging from 45 to 60% and subsidy ranging from 15 to 50% of project cost
Brief bio-data of Board of Directors

Venture Capital Assistance Scheme_Small Farmers Agri Business Consortium ( SFAC)_Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc:
Under Venture Capital Assistance Scheme, financial support will be provided in the form of an interest free loan provided by SFAC to qualifying projects to meet shortfall in the capital requirement for implementation of the project. This amount will be repayable back to SFAC after the repayment of term loan of lending institution. Financial Institutions notified for the scheme are national banks, SBI and its Subsidiary, IDBI, SIDBI, NABARD, NCDC, NEDFi, RRBs and State financial corporation. They can recommend proposal after sanction of Term Loan.

Eligible amount under VCA scheme:
(a) North East and Hilly states: 40% of equity or Rs. 50 lakh, whichever is less .
(b) Rest of the country: 26% of equity or Rs. 50 lakh whichever is less.
(c) 40% of equity or Rs. 50 lakh whichever is less for FPCs

list.value: Financial support in the form of an interest free loan

Financing for Fishery Cooperative_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc:
NCDC has been assisting fisheries cooperatives since 1974-75. Activities assisted under this financing scheme are:

1. Purchase of operational inputs such as fishing boats, nets, and engines
2. Creation of infrastructure facilities for marketing, transport vehicles, ice plants, cold storage, retail outlets, processing units, etc.
3. Development of inland fisheries, seed farms, hatcheries, etc.
4. Preparation of feasibility reports.
5. Integrated Fisheries Projects (Marine, Inland and Brackish Water)

NCDC will provide support in the form of: 
Term Loan: 65 %
Subsidy: 15 to 25%
Members’ contribution: 10 to 20%

Financing for Dairy/Livestock_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc:
NCDC is providing direct loans to Dairy and Livestock and Livestock cooperatives for a wide variety of activities such as: 

1. Establishment of Integrated Dairy and Livestock and Livestock Project with the provisions for the technical inputs for farmer’s organization, mobile veterinary care, artificial insemination, and fodder development program.
2. Establishment/Expansion/renovation of Milk Collection Centers and Chilling Plants.
3. Purchase of equipment, transport vehicles, etc.
4. Purchase, rearing, and breeding of milch animals.
5. Setting up of small feed mixing/manufacturing units, laboratory, etc.
6. Margin Money, working capital, share capital.

NCDC will provide support in the form of: 
Term Loan: 65 %
Subsidy: 15 to 25%
Members’ contribution: 10 to 20%

However, in case of strengthening of share capital base/margin money/working capital assistance, the quantum of assistance can be up to 100%

Financing for Poultry Cooperative_NCDC_ Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
descriptor.long_desc:
Poultry is a very important subsidiary activity in rural areas particularly for the landless and weaker sections of the rural community. With a view to developing poultry farming in the cooperative sector, the corporation has been extending its assistance to poultry Cooperatives since 1974-75. 
Activities assisted:

1. Establishment of a cluster of poultry units with rearing capacity ranging from 5000 and more for each unit with low input technology birds as well as hybrid variety birds provision for selling pullets to member farmers for backyard poultry farming.
2. Assistance to societies for incubators, hatcheries, and accessories for providing Day Old Chicks to societies engaged in poultry activities.
3. Assistance for the marketing of poultry products by involving producer members.
4. Poultry dressing units with a minimum capacity of 300 birds per day.
5. Sanction of additional funds to existing Integrated Cooperative Poultry Projects already assisted by NCDC towards the expansion of existing capacity and margin money.

NCDC will provide support in the form of: 
Term Loan: 65 %
Subsidy: 15 to 25%
Members’ contribution: 10 to 20%

descriptor.name: Agriclinic and Agribusiness Centres Scheme - NABARD (Central)
descriptor.long_desc: This programme offered by the Ministry of Agriculture and NABARD aims to tap the expertise available in the large pool of Agriculture Graduates. Irrespective of whether a fresh graduate or not, or whether currently employed or not, one can set up your own AgriClinic or AgriBusiness Centre and offer professional extension services to innumerable farmers. Agribusiness Centres would provide paid services for enhancement of agriculture production  and income of farmers. It provides free 2 months training to set up the centre as well as bank loans and credit linked back ended composite subsidy for project costs upto Rs. 20 lakh for individual projects and Rs.100 lakhs for a group project.

list.value: Two-month training, handholding support to set up business venture, refresher trainings, loan and back-ended subsidy for the venture

Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana (Central)
descriptor.long_desc: This scheme provides financial assistance (₹ 6000 per year in three installments) to farmer families having cultivable land to increase crop production. The scheme aims to supplement the financial needs of the farmers in procuring various inputs to ensure proper crop health and appropriate yields, commensurate with the anticipated farm income.

Mission Organic Value Chain Development for North Eastern Region (MOVCD) (Central)
descriptor.long_desc: The Mission for Organic Value Chain Development for North-East Region (MOVCD-NER) is a Central Sector Scheme, for implementation in the states of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim and Tripura The scheme aims at development of certified organic production in a value chain mode to link growers with consumers and to provide the financial support for the development of entire organic value chain including inputs, seeds, certification, to the creation of facilities for collection, aggregation, processing marketing and brand building initiative. It also aims to to facilitate partnerships between farmers and organic businesses [Local enterprises and / or Farmer Producer Companies (FPC)] in domestic and export markets.

list.value: Various benefits such as financial assistance for on-farm input production unit and  off-farm inputs , quality seed, setting up of cold storage etc is provided

Distribution of Seed Minikits of Pulses (Central)
descriptor.long_desc:
Under NFSM, assistance is given to farmers for the demonstration of the latest crop production and protection technology, distribution, and production of seeds of HYVs / Hybrids. 
Under the NFSM cluster, seeds of unique varieties of pulses are distributed in the form of seed mini-kits free of cost to the farmers. 
The Seed Minikits programme is a significant tool for introducing new varieties of seeds in the farmers fields and is instrumental for increasing the seed replacement rate. 
Each mini kit contains treated seed, bio-fertllizer packets, leaflets having package of practices, and characteristics of the varieties in regional languages.

list.value: Free distribution of Seed Minikits of Pulses

descriptor.name: Kisan Credit card (Central)
descriptor.long_desc:
This scheme helps farmers to access timely and adequate credit. With this card, the farmers can have cash credit facilities without repeatedly going through time-consuming bank credit screening processes. It is issued to farmers based on their holdings so that farmers may use them to readily purchase agriculture inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc and draw cash for their production needs. The credit support may be used for to meet the short term credit requirements for cultivation of crops, post-harvest expenses, produce marketing loan, consumption requirements of farmer household, working capital for maintenance of farm assets and activities allied to agriculture and investment credit requirement for agriculture and allied activities. Commercial Banks, RRBs, Small Finance Banks and Cooperatives implement the scheme.
This scheme provides credit to the farmer up to Rs. 3 lakh, if farmer repaid his/her amount timely then 3% interest subvention given to the farmers.

list.value: Single credit facility/term loan for all agricultural requirements

descriptor.name: PAN Card for Enterprise_(Central)
descriptor.long_desc: The government of India has made PAN mandatory for all entities that are generating income in the country, whether it is an individual business, a company, an HUF, a partnership firm or a trust. Having a PAN is beneficial for the enterpise in a number of ways:  1. PAN is an enterprise’s tax identity. 2. Used by the Income Tax Department to track all the financial transactions. Even if you do not fall in the tax bracket, you are required to possess PAN. 3. If enterprises do not have PAN and are generating income, it is considered as withholding of information from the government. 4. PAN will help an enterprise in filing Income Tax Returns and in getting different types of invoices and remittances.

list.value: Affidavit sworn front of a magistrate stating date of birth
Birth Certificate issued by Registrar (Births and Deaths)
Post Office Passbook Having Address Of The Applicant

descriptor.name: Fisheries and Aquaculture Infrastructure Development Fund (FIDF)_Department of Fisheries
descriptor.long_desc: Under the scheme interest subsidy up to 3% per annum will be provided for establishment of fisheries based infrastructure facilities. The applicants to the scheme shall be eligible for loan up to 80% of the estimated /actual project cost from scheduled commercial banks, directly or routed by NCDC channel partners. Beneficiaries are required to contribute at least 20% of the project cost as margin money. Bank financing will be available for a term of 12 years inclusive of moratorium of 2 years on principal amount. The interest rate will be determined by the bank and should be more than 5% p.a. Specific activities permissible are:   1. Establishment of Fishing Harbours 2. Establishment of Fish Landing Centres 3. Infrastructure for Mariculture and Advanced Inland Fisheries (Ocean farming, Cage Culture etc.)

list.value: 1. Quantum of Loan: The project under FIDF shall be eligible for loan up to 80% of the estimated/actual project cost;  2. Interest Subvention: Up to 3% per annum for development of identified fisheries- based infrastructure facilities.

descriptor.name: Registration-cum-Membership Certificate (RCMC)_Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority
descriptor.long_desc:
A Registration-cum-Membership Certificate (RCMC) from the Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA) is required to export agricultural products from India. The RCMC is valid for five years, starting on April 1 of the year it is issued and ending on March 31 of the fifth year. 

APEDA is mandated with the responsibility of export promotion and development of the following scheduled products:

1. Fruits, Vegetables and their Products.
2. Meat and Meat Products.
3. Poultry and Poultry Products.
4. Dairy Products.
5. Confectionery, Biscuits and Bakery Products.
6. Honey, Jaggery and Sugar Products.
7. Cocoa and its products, chocolates of all kinds.
8. Alcoholic and Non-Alcoholic Beverages.
9. Cereal and Cereal Products.
10. Groundnuts, Peanuts and Walnuts.
11. Pickles, Papads and Chutneys.
12. Guar Gum.
13. Floriculture and Floriculture Products.
14. Herbal and Medicinal Plants.

list.value: Importer - Exporter Code (IEC)_Directorate General of Foreign Trade
= Manufacture of food products and beverages

descriptor.name: Transport and Marketing Assistance for specified Agriculture products_Directorate General of Foreign Trade
descriptor.long_desc: The “Transport and Marketing Assistance” (TMA) for specified agriculture products scheme aims to provide assistance for the international component of freight and marketing of agricultural produce which is likely to mitigate disadvantage of higher cost of transportation of export of specified agriculture products due to trans-shipment and to promote brand recognition for Indian agricultural products in the specified overseas markets. Financial assistance will be provided in cash through direct bank transfer as part reimbursement of freight charges paid per tonne / TEU of cargo shipped. FOB supplies where no freight is paid by Indian exporters are not covered under this scheme. The level of assistance would be different for different regions as notified from time to time for export of eligible products.

list.value: Financial assistance for freight charges paid per tonne / TEU of cargo shipped.

descriptor.name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund_Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare (Central)
descriptor.long_desc: This scheme by the Ministry of Agriculture provides financing from banks and financial institutions as loans to PACS, Cooperative Societies, Farmer Producers Organizations(FPOs), Self Help Group (SHG), Agri-entrepreneurs, Startups, etc. which will have interest subvention/subsidy of 3% per annum on loans up to a limit of Rs. 2 crore, as well as credit guarantee coverage for a loan amount upto Rs. 2 crore, with guarantee fee paid by the government. The subsidy will be available for a maximum period of 7 years, including moratorium period of 6 months to a maximum of 2 years.    The scheme will facilitate setting up and modernization of key elements of the value chain including:    1. Post Harvest Management Projects like  Supply chain services including e-marketing platforms,  Warehouses, Sorting &grading units, Cold chains, Logistics facilities, Primary processing centres, Ripening Chambers, etc.  2. Viable projects for building community farming assets including  Organic / Bio stimulant production units, Projects identified for providing supply chain infrastructure for clusters of crops including export clusters, etc.

list.value: Interest subsidy of 3% per annum upto Rs. 2 crore and credit guarantee upto Rs. 2 crore on loans taken for post harvest management activities for 7 years period
Shareholder List and Share Capital contribution by each member verified and certified by a CA/Co-operative Auditors

descriptor.name: Prime Minister Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises (PMFME) (Central)
descriptor.long_desc:
The scheme provides increased access to credit by micro food processing entrepreneurs. Individual micro food processing units would be provided credit-linked capital subsidy of 35% of the eligible project cost with a maximum ceiling of Rs.10.0 lakh per unit. The applicant should be willing to contribute 10% of the project cost.

*Only one person from one family would be eligible for obtaining financial assistance. 
*The applicant should have their existing infrastructure/work shed. 
*District Resource Persons have been appointed in each district to assist applicants  in preparation of DPRs, getting a bank loan, training,
upgradation of the unit, getting necessary regulatory approvals.

list.value: Credit-linked capital subsidy of 35% of the total project cost.
